result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were revoked, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant David A Charpentier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: to Dismiss s/BNB/6-23-17
for Dismissal
Telephone conference on June 21, 2017 at 09:20 am.
returned Order for repayment of Atty fees
Order for repayment of Atty fees s/BNB/5-18-17
Atty Fees

Defendant David A Charpentier in court with attorney Erik C. Johnson.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM25, 16CM97, 16CM99 and 16CM142 tracking together:
  Atty Hendee states that in 15CM25 the state has a motion to terminate the DPA and the defendant has no objection.  Atty Johhson agrees to the termination.  Defendant agrees.
BY THE COURT:  Court will terminate the DPA in 15CM25 and finds the defendant guilty of that charge and enters the conviction as of today's date.

  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1 in 15CM25, Ct. 3 in 16CM97 and Ct. 1 in 16CM142.  Counts 1, 2 & 4 in 16CM97 to be dismissed and Counts 2 & 3 in 16CM142 and Ct. 1 in 16CM99 to be dismissed and read-in.
Atty Johnson agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1 in 15CM25, Ct. 3 in 16CM97 and Ct. 1 in 16CM142.  
Counts 1, 2 & 4 in 16CM97 to be dismissed
Counts 2 & 3 in 16CM142 and Ct. 1 in 16CM99 to be dismissed and read-in.

Atty Hendee asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.
Atty Johnson makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  15CM25, Ct. 1:  Court orders 30 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence
  Report on or before June 2 , 2017 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
Court Costs = $243.00
$100 Domestic Abuse Surcharge
  DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
bond to be applied to all cases, first on restitution
Attorney fees to be paid

16CM97, Ct. 3:  Court orders 60 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence
Report on or before June 2 , 2017 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
Court Costs = $243.00
  DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
Attorney fees to be paid

16CM142, Ct. 1:   Court orders 60 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence
Report on or before June 2 , 2017 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
Court Costs = $243
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
Credit = 1 day
Attorney fees to be paid

16CM99:  Restitution = $25.37
Attorney fees to be paid

  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan for the balances of costs and Attorney fees:  $50.00/month commencing on August 1, 2017

Counts 1, 2 & 4 in 16CM97 to be dismissed
Counts 2 & 3 in 16CM142 and Ct. 1 in 16CM99 to be dismissed and read-in.

s/BNB/09-22-16
Atty Erik C. Johnson
Petition for Appoinment of An Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency
Motion hearing on November 3, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant David A Charpentier in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
*15CM25, 16CM97 & 16CM99 tracking together:
Court questions the defendant regarding counsel.  Defendant called the PD office and he does not qualify; he filled out the financial for the court appointed Attorney.  

BY THE COURT:  Defendant to file the financial today with the COC office.   
Reset one more time.
bond continued.  Motion hearing scheduled for November 3, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Motion hearing on September 21, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant David A Charpentier in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant now appears in court.
BY THE COURT:  Warrant will be quashed.

Defendant does not remember getting the motion.  Court confirms the defendant's address.  Atty Hendee states that the motion was sent to an old address.
  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Clerk gives a copy of the motion and affidavit to the defendant.
Atty Hendee asks that the three matters be set together.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
bond continued.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 21, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant David A Charpentier not in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that this is a motion to terminate.    Atty Hendee requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear.  

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue.

Waiver of Right to Atty

Defendant David A Charpentier in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Defendant to enter plea to Cts 1 & 2 and state will recommend an 18 month DPA with dismissal upon successful completion.  Defendant agrees.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant waives his right to counsel.  Court questions defendant and finds the waiver to be made freely, voluntarily & intelligently.
Defendant enters No Contest plea to Cts 1 & 2.  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.
  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges and accepts defendant's plea.
BY THE COURT:  Court approves the 18 month DPA.
Return date at 06-18-2015 02:30 pm

Defendant David A Charpentier in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant did not show at the pre-trial.  The defendant spoke before court to Atty Hendee and he thought they were meeting today.
Atty Hendee asks that this be reset because he will have to speak about the offer.
  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Return date at 05-21-2015 03:30 pm

Defendant David A Charpentier in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states at the last hearing the defendant wanted to get an Attorney.  Defendant states that he called the PD office and did not hear back from him.  Defendant wants to meet with the DA.  Court advises the defendant that he would have to waive his right to an Attorney.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.
Court accepts defendant's waiver.

BY THE COURT:  Set for return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Return date on April 1, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
Defendant would like to contact either the public defender or hire his own attorney.
BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

*Court Reporter appears by phone*
Defendant David A Charpentier in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court questions defendant on his failure to appear yesterday.  Defendant makes statement.  BY THE COURT:  Court will quash warrant authorized yesterday.  Court will also reinstate the bond and conditions that were forfeited yesterday. 
  Return date scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant David A Charpentier not in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee requests warrant on defendant's failure to appear.  Also requests forfeiture of the cash bond posted.  BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue.  Cash bond is ordered forfeited.
